member.name: T:SDammann.WebApi.Versioning.AcceptHeaderVersionedControllerSelector
member.summary: Version controller that enables version by MIME type in the accept header

member.name: T:SDammann.WebApi.Versioning.AcceptHeaderVersionedControllerSelectorBase
member.summary: Represents an implementation that supports versioning and selects an controller based on versioning by convention (namespace.Api.Version1.xxxController). The controller to invoke is determined by the "version" key in the "Accept" HTTP header.

member.name: T:SDammann.WebApi.Versioning.VersionedControllerSelector
member.summary: Represents an implementation that supports versioning and selects an controller based on versioning by convention (namespace.Api.Version1.xxxController). How the actual controller to be invoked is determined, is up to the derived class to implement.

member.name: M:SDammann.WebApi.Versioning.VersionedControllerSelector.#ctor(System.Web.Http.HttpConfiguration)
member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class.

member.name: M:SDammann.WebApi.Versioning.VersionedControllerSelector.GetControllerNameFromRequest(System.Net.Http.HttpRequestMessage)
member.summary: Gets the name of the controller from the request route date

member.name: P:SDammann.WebApi.Versioning.VersionedControllerSelector.ControllerSuffix
member.summary: Gets the suffix in the Controller s

member.name: P:SDammann.WebApi.Versioning.VersionedControllerSelector.VersionPrefix
member.summary: Gets the prefix used for identifying a controller version in a .. Examples and usage in remarks.

remarks.para: Make sure to set this property in the Application_Start method.

For example, when this is set to "V", a controller in the namespace of Company.V1.ProductController will identify the ProductController as being version 1, but will not identify Company.Version1.ProductController as being a version 1 controller.

member.name: M:SDammann.WebApi.Versioning.AcceptHeaderVersionedControllerSelectorBase.#ctor(System.Web.Http.HttpConfiguration)
member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class.

member.summary: Returns the API version from the collection with accept header values. Derived classes may override this.

member.name: M:SDammann.WebApi.Versioning.AcceptHeaderVersionedControllerSelectorBase.GetVersion(System.Net.Http.Headers.MediaTypeWithQualityHeaderValue)
member.summary: Derived classes implement this to return an API version from the specified mime type string

member.summary: Specifies the media type to accept. Set this in your Application_Start or before.

member.name: T:SDammann.WebApi.Versioning.VersionHeaderVersionedControllerSelector
member.summary: Represents an implementation that supports versioning and selects an controller based on versioning by convention (namespace.Api.Version1.xxxController). The controller to invoke is determined by the number in the "X-Api-Version" HTTP header.
